isis.stitle: 8 SPEED, 9 SPEED, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON SERIES - INSTALL - RIGHT COUNTERSHAFT ASSEMBLY

note.para: The left countershaft assembly MUST remain in time with main drive gear when timing right countershaft assembly.

step1.para: Remove blocking from right countershaft assembly and place it parallel to the mainshaft assembly. Mesh the marked tooth of the right countershaft drive gear with the remaining set of two marked teeth on the main drive gear ( Figure 396).

figure.caption: Figure 395. Mesh Marked Tooth of Right Countershaft Drive Gear With Marked Teeth on Main Drive Gear

step1.para: Insert the countershaft support tool or blocking in the rear bearing bore ( Figure 397).

figure.caption: Figure 396. Insert Countershaft Support Tool or Blocking in Rear Bearing Bore

step1.para: Position the right countershaft bearings in the same manner described for left countershaft bearings.
With bearing installation complete, install the snap ring in the right countershaft rear groove ( Figure 398).

figure.caption: Figure 397. Install Snap Ring in Right Countershaft Rear Groove

step1.para: Move the reverse gear to the rear on the mainshaft and use a screwdriver to engage sliding clutches with all forward speed gears ( Figure 399). A sliding clutch that will not engage with a gear indicates the gear set is not in proper mesh. The bearings of the right countershaft would then need to be removed and the drive gear set retimed.

figure.caption: Figure 398. Engage Sliding Clutches With All Forward Speed Gears

note.para: Do not engage sliding clutches with more than one gear at the same time. This will lock the gearing and prevent the mainshaft and countershaft assemblies from rotating.
